page.title: 19OGBOURNE PAST AND PRESENT
page.content: The{census returns}for Ogbourne St Andrew in 1881 show that a high pecentage of the population worked on farms or in jobs linked with {agriculture.}When a child left school at 13 he was most likely to go to work on a farm,and he would probably work there for the rest of his life.In 1881 {transport facilities}were not as good as they are today.Therefore the village would act as a small community having its own school,bakery and church.Because of modern transport facilities the village does not act to day as a self supporting community. Clubs and suchlike are based at the nearby town of{Marlborough.}It does not have a state school or bakery,but it does still have a church.The agricultural emphasis is still there in the surrounding area,but most people commute to work elsewhere.
